thread.title: Verizon and T-Mobile are having the weirdest Twitter fight right now - The Verge
thread.title_full: Verizon and T-Mobile are having the weirdest Twitter fight right now - The Verge

author: Kwame Opam
title: Verizon and T-Mobile are having the weirdest Twitter fight right now - The Verge
text: Feb 5, 2017, 10:07pm EST Supported by share Earlier this evening, T-Mobile aired its third Super Bowl spot, this time aimed squarely at Verizon. Starring Kristen Schaal in a send-up of Fifty Shades of Grey , the ad tried to turn the pain of being on Verizon’s network into a BDSM relationship. It was weird. Of course, Verizon decided to clap back on Twitter, starting a pretty bizarre war of words. Yes @Tmobile , we're into BDSM. Bigger coverage map, Devastating Speed, and Massive capacity. I mean, that’s one way to put it. Of course, T-Mobile CEO John Legere couldn’t help but respond: . @verizon guys... it can't go any further. calm down. pic.twitter.com/jINXguIUAD — John Legere (@JohnLegere) February 6, 2017 Verizon wouldn’t back down: Unfortunately no one will hear your safe word if you're on @Tmobile . But T-Mo is calling it for now: They broke our Jealousy-O-Meter! Those aren't cheap, Vzw... https://t.co/Yh7MjGtcf4
